Class AdminController

java.lang.Object
photosfx.AdminController
public class AdminController extends Object
The AdminController class is responsible for managing the admin interface in the PhotosFX application. It allows the admin to view, create, and delete users, as well as manage the user list displayed in the UI.

This class interacts with the application's data layer to retrieve and modify user information. It also provides feedback to the admin through alerts and confirmation dialogs.

FXML elements such as ListView and TextField are used to display and input user data. The class is initialized with the current FXML context and populates the user list from the data source.

Key functionalities include:

  • Displaying the list of users
  • Adding a new user
  • Deleting an existing user
  • Handling user input and providing feedback

Note: This class uses JavaFX components and requires proper setup of the FXML file and data layer.

  • Constructor Details

    • AdminController

      public AdminController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the AdminController by setting the current FXML context and populating the user list. This method is called automatically by the JavaFX framework when the FXML file is loaded.

    • newUsernameFieldKeyPressed

      public void newUsernameFieldKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Handles the key press event for the username field. If the Enter key is pressed, it triggers the createUser method.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - the key event triggered by the user

    • createUser

      public void createUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Creates a new user based on the input from the username field. If the username is empty or already exists, an alert is shown to the user.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by the user

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Deletes the selected user from the user list. If no user is selected, an alert is shown to the user. A confirmation dialog is displayed to confirm the deletion.
      Parameters:
      event - the action event triggered by the user
